title: Three more arrests in synagogue attack investigation; Lammy heckled at vigil for Manchester synagogue attack – latest
summary: Police have arrested three additional suspects, raising the total to six in connection with a recent terror attack. Justice Secretary faces public backlash and shouts of "shame on you" during a gathering to honor the victims. The community is coming together to remember those affected by the tragedy.

title: French sees off Leigh to put Wigan in Grand Final after week of acrimony
summary: Bevan French scored two first-half tries, leading to Wigan's 18-6 victory in the Super League playoff semi-final against Leigh. Jai Field made a crucial tackle in the second half to help secure the win. The victory advances Wigan to the finals.

title: Semenyo’s double downs Fulham and sends buoyant Bournemouth second
summary: Bournemouth secured a 3-1 home victory over Fulham, with Justin Kluivert scoring a stunning goal and Antoine Semenyo netting two. This win propelled Bournemouth to second place in the Premier League. The victory marks a significant achievement for the team in the league.

title: Hamas agrees to release all Israeli hostages, dead or alive, as it accepts parts of Trump’s Gaza plan – live
summary: A group has consented to release all remaining hostages, but they indicate that additional negotiations are necessary regarding other elements of a 20-point plan. The discussions aim to address outstanding issues beyond the hostage release. This move reflects a commitment to ongoing dialogue and resolution.

title: Henry Arundell leads Bath to nervy win against Sale as Borthwick takes note
summary: Bath secured a solid 28-16 victory over Sale, fueled by strong performances from Henry Arundell, Cameron Redpath, and Beno Obano, who built a substantial lead. Despite Sale's efforts in the second half, they were unable to close the gap. The win solidifies Bath's performance in the match.
